Description: Gibson Dependable Home of the most First and most Dependable Gibson parts on Ebay U.S.A. and Worldwide Bidders Welcomed Please note that we do not participate in Ebay's Global Shipping Program.Out international buyers will not be required to pay import fees upfront during checkout through Ebay. How many of you Gibson fans out there have always wanted to build yourselves that awesome Gibson project guitar, but didn’t want to spend the money on a Gibson guitar only to dismantle it. Well, here is your opportunity do so. We sell Gibson parts and project guitars specifically for the purpose of building your own custom Gibson guitar. Who says Fender has to be the only good project brand out there. Our goal is to change that myth by offering quality Gibson projects and parts to those of you who want to create that ultimate Gibson dream guitar. Neck: Rounded neck.Headstock: Says "Made In USA" on the back.Serial Number: 88560622Year: 1980 Fretboard: Rosewood with scale of 24 ¾.Inlays: Dot.Includes: Comes with Truss Rod, Truss Rod Cover, Pickguard, Neck Plate, Nut, Frets, & Ground Wire. Condition: The back has some finish scratches and a nick.The back of the neck has a few dings. The headstock corners have a few dings.The frets have a patina on them. Otherwise the guitar is in good condition.Please Note: Unless mentioned otherwise under the condition section, the neck is straightwith no cracks, breaks, or pitting to it and the frets have no wear. Please feel free to ask questions you may have. Only contact us through the auction within Ebay. Any messages sent to an e-mail address will not be received. Also, please make question relevant to the listing. Non-relevant questions will be ignored. What do I do if there is an issue with my item when I receive it? If you receive an item and have an issue with it, please contact us first before leaving feedback and before opening a dispute case so that the issue can be resolved properly. We are unable to resolve issues when a third party, such as Ebay or Paypal, is involved. What shipping costs the buyer actually pays for: (Present on the printed package label.) The cost of the chosen shipping service estimated by the weight, size, and destination of the package. (Not Present on the printed package label.) The cost of Stamps.com shipping insurance which averages from $1.29 to $5.06 depending on the item value. (Not Present on the printed package label.) The cost of packaging which varies from $.26 to $7.80 depending on the size and type of package.(Not Present on the printed package label.) The cost of bubble wrap and tape if it is necessary for the package. This can be $.00 to $1.05 depending on the size and type of package.(Not Present on the printed package label.) The cost of the label and printer ink. This cost is $.17.(Not Present on the printed package label.) Ebay's 9% final shipping value fee they now charge sellers on shipping costs. This can range from $.29 to $8.32. Ebay charges this fee because to many buyers have complained about high shipping fees. Ebay feels this fee will help curve the issue. Coincidentally Ebay does not return this fee to the buyer, but keeps it for themselves. We feel that if the average buyer was made aware of the real total shipping costs, then maybe they would be less likely to assuming the cost of shipping on the package label is the total cost of shipping. For Example, when you pay $35 for shipping on a guitar body from us and then read only $25 on the package label, keep in mind that there are other unseen costs that go into the total shipping cost. We charge only the bare minimum for shipping. We want to remove this final shipping value fee from our total shipping fees in order to bring them down again. So buyers, please contact Ebay and push them to remove this seller fee from their system. Ebay must learn to stop punishing all sellers for the faults of only a few. Also, we have some of the best experience with shipping these products around the country and world. Whenever we search through listings we rarely see shipping charges that are much more than the total cost of shipping from other sellers. Much of the time we see charges where the seller is likely losing money on the final value because of their low shipping charges. USA Shipping Winner pays for all shipping and packaging costs.
